summary: This is an email chain between US Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY) prosecutors and a PAE contractor regarding the production of evidence in the US v. Epstein case. It discusses the status of document productions, including 40,000 images and FBI materials, and notes delays in processing electronic device data, with concerns about meeting a November 9, 2020 production deadline.

persons.name: Ted
persons.context: Addressed in email regarding evidence production updates; likely a prosecutor at SDNY.

persons.context: SDNY prosecutor forwarding updates on evidence production from PAE contractor, discussing delays and next steps.

persons.context: PAE contractor providing detailed update on evidence being sent to SDNY, including specific production numbers and timelines.

connections.description: Prosecutor and e-discovery analyst communicating about evidence production logistics and timelines.
SDNY prosecutors collaborating on case evidence management.

events.title: Evidence Production Update
events.description: Email chain discusses status of evidence production in US v. Epstein case, including shipment of materials and delays in processing electronic device data.

events.title: Production Deadline
events.description: Deadline for producing evidence in the case, which PAE indicates may not be fully met due to processing delays.

events.title: Image Availability
events.description: Earliest date when approximately 1.2 million records being imaged will be available in the workspace.

keyFacts: Evidence production in US v. Epstein case included 40,000 images, documents from FBI Florida boxes, and FBI FOIA office documents, but not electronic device data.
PAE contractor was processing approximately 1.2 million records, with imaging expected by November 2, 2020.
SDNY prosecutors expressed concern that the November 9, 2020 production deadline might not be met due to processing delays.
Multiple specific production identifiers (SDNYPROD008 through SDNYPROD014) were referenced as being shipped.
The email chain highlights the logistical challenges and volume of evidence in the Epstein case investigation.
